turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: A little early for a delivery.

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: ...yeah.  Tryin' to get most of my day done before it hits nine-...

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: Sam?  Andy gave Sam a nice big desk to park his fat ass behind.

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: Where do you want this stuff?

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: Hey, I'm with you on that one, my man. Prick.

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: Look, you need me to sign an invoice or somethin'?

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: Uh, between this month and last month, you owe four hundred and seventeen dollars.  And we need that in cash.

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: Yeah, well, Darlene didn't say anything about it to me, so tell Andy to bill her like usual and let them sort it out. Move.

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: Well, he told me to collect cash.

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: Hey, you and I are seein' eye to eye on a whole range of issues this mornin'.

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: Except for the fact that I need cash.

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: He could've.  That-That's true.  But that would've been smart...

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: ...two things Andy is not.  Uh, but I tell you what.

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: Bein' that it's cash, I'm gonna give you ten percent...

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: ...off.  Say, uh, three seventy-five. Seein' that we both have so much love...

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: ...for Andy, I'll tell him I lost a few cartons comin' over  the mountain.

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: That'll make up the difference, huh?

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: Well, Darlene usually gives me a signed check for emergencies.  I could always give you that.

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: No, no, no, no, no, no. Wait.

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: Dude in uniform get in your face, you do not shoot your mouth off.

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: No, no, no.  You don't need my truck. You need somebody else's truck...

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: Look, if I don't get this stuff to McGruder, it's goodbye, Andy's Ice Cream, goodbye, Jerome, goodbye, Mon-...

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: Wait, wait.  You don't believe the dead guy, do...

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: Yeah, I believe him.  He was my friend.

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: Hey, listen!  Do you know what I think?  I...

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: ...think he was a wacko.  And I think that G.I. ninja's a bigger wacko.  And I think you're the biggest wack-...

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: ...-o of all, wantin' to be a part of this wacko shit!

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: You are seriously mistaken if you think you are going anywhere in my...

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: Then you drive me to McGrud-...

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: Look...I got two tons of the world's nastiest ice cream sittin' in a truck that should've been retired ten years ago.  That shit will be worthless by noon.

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: ...is as dangerous as you seem to think it is, I'm gettin' my ass as far away from you and it as possible.

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: Wait, wait, wait.  Hold up.  Hold up.  Look.

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: I got fifty bucks.  I'll get more.

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: I'll rent the truck from you.  You can stay here, you can go.  Whatever you want.

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: All right, then how about this?

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: Hey, you're gonna piss me--  What the hell are you supposed to be...

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: You are not takin' my truck!

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: Look, put this in the back.  Keep it safe.

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: There we go.  There we go.  Did you keep it safe?  Did you

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: What the hell is with you, dog?  He's the one with the damn gun.

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: You gave him ice cream, didn't you?  Come on, let's go.

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: Yeah, to keep him off my ass.

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: What did you do that for?  It makes him mean as a snake.

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: That dog was mean before I met him.

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: Come on, get in the truck.

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: I'm gonna bust a mudhole in your ass. I'm gonna--  Don't tell me to shut-- It's none of your business.  Man, I can talk all I want to.

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: It happens to this piece of shit...

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: Do you wanna give me a minute?

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: Suppose you're gonna shoot me because you can't get service on my cell phone.

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: Billings?  No, no, no, no, no.  We need to go to McGruder.

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: No, you gotta go to McGrud-...

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: No, no, no, no, no.  We gotta go to McGruder!  I go where the truck goes!

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: To get to McGruder, you have to go through Missoula, and I ain't goin' to Missoula.

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: No way.  We're goin' through McGrud-...

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: Look...I kinda borrowed the truck from Andy.

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: I did not steal this truck!

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: ...what all the bullshit about the cash was, wasn't it?!  You stole this truck, and now you're trying to sell...

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: I didn't steal the truck! He owed it to me!  Anyway, the important thing is I'm not goin' through Missoula!

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: Look, I don't give a shit if you go through Missoula at a hundred miles an hour.  We're goin' to McGruder.

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: I'm about to get in your ass like last year's underwear, man.

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: We can't push old Pete in this heat.  He can't take it.

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: Ah, one of them's in the back.

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: No, no, no, no, no.  Keep goin'.

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: You mean to tell me you hijacked me with an empty gun?!

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: Get him to stand up, Night Shift.

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: Don't gimme that "nice job" shit, man! They still got a vanload comin', and what do you got besides an empty...

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: Probably because they know a psycho when they hear one.

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: Hey, take a look at your situation and...

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: ...reconsider that statement there, Night Shift.  You're psy-...

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: Every time I look at you, I wanna hit...

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: And I'm a peaceful man, and...

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: ...you stole the truck to uphold your principles, right?

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: I did not steal the truck.

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: It was owed to me.  You stole the damn...

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: Shut up, shut up!  It's beeping.

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: Well, then, that means it's call...

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: You  snatch that  phone  from me one more time, I'm--

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: You can just bend over and kiss your crazy ass goodbye, buddy!

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: You think we can make what?!  You see that truck?!

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: Eight and a half feet wide!  Weighs over five tons!

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: Hey, and what if we  don't make it?!

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: Your weedkiller on steroids goes down with us!  Everybody  dies!

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: I don't think we have much of a choice...

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: Oh, Petey.  Oh, Petey.  Oh, please, Pete.  Please don't do this to me.  Okay.

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: I should've had that dog bite me.  I would've gotten rabies! Could've went to the hospital, had a pretty nurse!

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: Go, go, go, go, go.  Oh, shit.

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: I'm goin'.  I'm goin', baby.  I'm goin', I'm goin'.

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: ...-hood of you knowin' any prayers is slim...

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: All right, you got it, you got it!

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: What are you talkin' about?!  I'm the one drivin'!

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: Oh, Pete.  Oh, shit!  Oh, shit!

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: Gimme that, gimme that, gimme that.

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: Hey, put it back!  We're takin' off.

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: You're not dangerous!  You're crazy!  I ain't gettin' in this damn thing!

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: I don't want you to come anyway.

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: This thing just went up a degree.  Ice cream's not workin'.

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: This river's fed by a glacier.  Willing to bet my life that it's a good deal under fifty degrees.

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: Hey, you didn't happen to lock the truck up when you got out...

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: See, now why would you do that to a man in my posi-...

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: Hey, I didn't steal the truck.  You...

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: Hey, I told you I did not steal that truck.  Andy owes me a lot more than that four-wheeled...

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: It won't even start half the time.

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: I deserve a lot more than that truck! Ten years, ten years I busted my ass for that fat rat bastard.

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: And he swore, he swore once I got a degree...

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: ...there'd be a sales rep desk with my name on it.  But every time something opened up, there'd be some idiot cousin...

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: ...or nephew or some good old boy...

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: ...just ready to just slide him right in there.  And what about me, huh?  What about Arlo, huh?  What about my needs? You know, I got a-I got student loans...

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: Nobody's lookin' out for my interests.  My credit was fucked!  And then when he promoted Sam over me, I just snapped.  So I split.

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: So I took his truck, yeah.

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: You know, four years ago, I was a split end at Kentucky State.

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: Started every game my senior year.  Not all-American or anything, but not bad. Anyway, the real star was my best friend, the quarterback.  Got taken in the first round.

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: I remember him.  Got in a car crash or somethin'.

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: We were celebrating right after the draft, going from bar to bar.  I was drivin'.

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: And I put the car into a ditch.  He spent eighteen weeks in the...

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: Never gonna throw a ball in the pros.

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: Couldn't deal with it.  So I split.

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: And  things sort of just went downhill from there.

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: Anyway, about ten months ago, I wound up in Jerome, workin' for Darlene.

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: Well, shit.  Could be worse.  I mean, we're both up shit's creek, but at least we have a paddle.

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: ...for whatever it's worth, I'm sorry I dragged you into this...

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: To tell you the truth, you didn't.

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: I mean, if that gun was...

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: ...loaded, I didn't buy you as a shoot- ...

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: ...Long.  Somethin' about that look in his eye when he talked about that Elvis...

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: Well, all the same.  If we get to Missoula, help me find a car.  I'd appreciate it.  Then...you can...

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: Like I said, I got a pretty good idea of what's at stake here.

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: All right, all right.  Hey, hey.

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: I think you oughta cut a...

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: Even though it is nice to see Andy...

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: ...squirm, I don't want his brains all over my shirt...

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: Bullshit.  You would've killed us anyway.

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: Put your hand in my pants.

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: We're gonna die, and you want me to do some freaky shit like that?!

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: You just can't leave that stuff with that lu-...

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: That's why I didn't give it...

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: Aw, shit.  Would you be more care-...

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: What do you think I'm doin'?!

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: Can we get out on your end of the tunnel?

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: Well, hell, the smoke's gonna kill us anyway!

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: Got it?   Come on, darlin'.  I gotcha.

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: Arlo, I'm gonna get Elvis.  You go.

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: They'll meet you at the top.

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: Elvis is still in there!  It's gonna go off!

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: You know, we saved half a million people from a full-body peel.

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: They aren't exactly gonna publicize this,  Arlo.

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: Hey-Hey-Hey-Hey-Hey.  We are heroes, my man.  It's time to start actin' like it.

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: Excuse me.  I got a bullet in my leg.

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: Who had to put a gun to your head?

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: Who put the big hurt on...

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: ...that Army nut job to save your narrow butt?

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: Right.  You damn skippy.  And now that I am both jobless...

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: ...and-and-and truckless in the service of my country...

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: ...I feel that my government owes me a little restitution.

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: I'll handle this from here, sweet   Owes us a little restitution.

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: What about all that "no need to get in the man's...

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: I was not in the man's face.  I was nego-...

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: Look.  That's negotiating? He threatened to kill...

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: But he didn't.  See, that's negotiation.

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: Bullshit, yeah.  Well...if we're not gonna be famous, at least this'll be a great story to tell some ladies in a bar or somethin'.

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: You know, it's, uh-it's very hush-hush, as we say in the spy game.

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: It all started with our mission in Istanbul.

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: I was undercover as a tennis player.

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: My code name was Blackjack.  Night Shift was my coach.  Uh-Uh-Uh, I'm sorry. Mason was my coach.

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: Uh, he handled rackets, and I carried the balls.

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: you see, that was a-that was my mission.

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: To tell you the truth, we're looking for a scientist who's gone missing from the Tech Center.  Maybe you know him. Richard Long.

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: Give it to me now, or you'll be dead...

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: Don't be tedious, waiter.  Dr. Long called it Elvis.

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: I got three thousand dollars of highly perishable ice cream products that taste bad enough when it's...

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: Just give me Elvis and I'll make sure you have enough money for a dozen ice cream trucks.

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: I don't ever wanna see another ice cream...

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: Your move.  Okay, Vaughn, you drive.

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: I urge you to be persuasive.

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: This country trained me to kill...

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: Well, that just about figures for today.

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: It's, uh, parked just off of Highway Thirty-Five.

turns.speaker: ICE CREAM ANDY
turns.text: I did what I could for you...

turns.speaker: ICE CREAM ANDY
turns.text: ...Arlo, and you screwed me for it. Now, where's my goddamn truck?

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: I ain't got time to argue with you today, Andy.  But I can tell you this.  Takin' your truck pissed you off?

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: Why don't you get that tub of shit Sam to...

turns.speaker: ICE CREAM ANDY
turns.text: Look, I'm sorry. I'll make it up to you.  Whatever you want.  Please!

turns.speaker: LONG
turns.text: Mason, you have to take this...

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: Wait.  This town is full of trucks.  Nice new trucks.  You don't need to go...

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: So you called the damned thing Elvis

turns.speaker: LONG
turns.text: I had no idea how powerful it was.

turns.speaker: LONG
turns.text: Eighteen men were k- killed in sec-...

turns.speaker: LONG
turns.text: ...-onds...with just a fraction of what's in...

turns.speaker: LONG
turns.text: ...about the man who did this, he's-he's comin' after it.

turns.speaker: LONG
turns.text: ...have it.  You have to...have to get it to M...to McGruder.

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: No, sir.  I've never seen this guy before.

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: Sure as hell have met a few assholes like that, though.

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: Well, why don't they talk to the sage of Jerome here?!

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: ...the guy the Army guys are lookin' for!

turns.speaker: PAPPAS
turns.text: Bullshit.  Put the phone down, Mason.

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: ...on ice!  We've got Elvis on ice!

turns.speaker: VITELLI
turns.text: All right, gentlemen. We're about done here.  Fine job.

turns.speaker: VITELLI
turns.text: Your country and a lot of innocent people in it...

turns.speaker: VITELLI
turns.text: We do have to take into consideration that, through your courage...

turns.speaker: VITELLI
turns.text: ...and selfless actions, you did save millions of lives.

turns.speaker: VITELLI
turns.text: ...-listed personnel with detailed knowledge of classified secrets falling under the National Security Act.

turns.speaker: VITELLI
turns.text: In order to protect those secrets, I am authorized to fine you, imprison you...

turns.speaker: VITELLI
turns.text: ...to take any extreme measures I deem necessary...

turns.speaker: ARLO
turns.text: Are you crazy?!  Take the boat?!

turns.speaker: BIG RANGER
turns.text: Colonel Vitelli.  We got a busted-in cold vault inside.

turns.speaker: VITELLI
turns.text: Alert seventy-fifth rangers.  Code Blue. Tell them Elvis has left the building.

turns.speaker: VITELLI
turns.text: If you're right, Lewis, this Mason is one hell of a pro.  He must have a service record and a paper trail some-...

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: What the hell is all this about a detonation today?  We're scheduled...

turns.speaker: LONG
turns.text: I don't work for you, Captain Brynner.

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: Sweeney tells me you don't have computer confirmation?

turns.speaker: LONG
turns.text: You know, captain, if you hadn't spent so much of your career questioning your superiors, you might've found yourself with more gold leaf on your col-...

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: This isn't some kind of pissing contest, Long.  You may be in charge here, but those men out there are my responsi-...

turns.speaker: LONG
turns.text: Look, this is a scientific experiment, okay?

turns.speaker: LONG
turns.text: If it works, your stock at the Pentagon will go up along with mine.  I don't think I need to mention you could use the help.

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: The NSA thinks the UN is onto your work...

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: ...here, and the White House is screaming about chemical weapons,  and we're...

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: ...sittin' here with our hands in the goddamn cookie jar!  And let me tell you something else.  I didn't join the service to let people like you turn...

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: ...the United States into the kind of country we're supposed to be fighting against.

turns.speaker: LONG
turns.text: But you have no choice but to follow orders.

turns.speaker: LONG
turns.text: Now, I know.  You have moral objections to what we're doing here, but believe...

turns.speaker: LONG
turns.text: ...me, if I thought there was any real danger, I-I wouldn't go forward.

turns.speaker: LONG
turns.text: You have my word on that.

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: All right.  One more shot, provided...  we're off the island tonight.

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: Damn you, Long!  My people are out there! Your people are out there!

turns.speaker: LONG
turns.text: ...I wish they would've let me say something...

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: There's nothing to say, doctor.  Someone had to take the fall, and they still need you, whereas...I've never been anything more than a thorn in their collective side, as you once said.

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: ...not at all like a man responsible for the deaths of eighteen peo-...

turns.speaker: LONG
turns.text: Is that why you're here?  To blame...

turns.speaker: LONG
turns.text: ...me?  Well, you could've saved yourself the trip.

turns.speaker: LONG
turns.text: I know where the  blame belongs.  But I didn't put you in prison, Andrew.  The government did...

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: Oh, I'm well aware of what the government did, I assure you.  Actually, I've just come to say how grateful I am to you...

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: Together, you gave me the opportunity to realize just how very wrong my life had gone.

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: Do you remember telling me once that all through my career, I'd never fit in?  Well...

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: ...you were right, of course.  But after...

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: ...years of thinking the matter over, I began to see that the whole thing wasn't really my problem.

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: What rational man could fit in with the sorts of things our government was doing? The sorts of things you've...

turns.speaker: LONG
turns.text: Do you think I haven't seen the bodies of those...

turns.speaker: LONG
turns.text: ...men every time I've closed my eyes?  But after you went away, I--

turns.speaker: LONG
turns.text: All right.  After they put you away...

turns.speaker: LONG
turns.text: ...I began trying to find ways of controlling the effects of the weapon that we tested on Horn Island.

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: And let me guess.  You failed.

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: Why is it you scientists can create implements of destruction...
